Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Oesibius
Reviews.Content: This is for sure not a 4* hotel as they claim, but a good basic hotel. Took single room, which was EXTREMELY small (took some pics and will try to upload). I felt like sleeping in a reconverted service room. Shower tub very narrow as well (and I'm fit). If you're really only there for sleeping though, as I was, this is probably enough, considering room, bathroom and common areas were all very clean. A few bleach stains on the carpet, which indeed make it look dirty at some spots (mentioned in other reviews), but on the other hand I like to know they use bleach... All members of staff were very polite, helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good and has enough variety: choice of cakes, pastries, cereals, breads, toppings (jams and chocolate paste), fresh fruits (both full and peeled+sliced), salads, eggs (boiled and scrambled... latter one a bit too dry in my opinion), bacon and sausages, juices (non fsh squeezed though), coffee/tea/infusions/chocolate. No restaurant for other meals than breakfast though. There is a bar (which I did not try). No wifi in the rooms, only in lobby: disappointing if there for work.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Romon and Arriana”
Reviews.Author: teresa t
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the peopel of your's hotel Arriana and Ramon, they are so kind and friendly and help us verry well!!!! Thank you from all my hart

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel poor location”
Reviews.Author: Danermag
Reviews.Content: I went to this Hotel with my daughter for a three night stay and was dissapointed to find the twin room I requested was not available ( late rooms .com did not pass on the comments to the Hotel however the staff at the Hotel sorted it first thing in the morning, the Hotel is a very clean and modern with very obliging staff who were very friendly , the downside is that the Hotel is quite a bit outside Rome ( ten minute walk to the metro and a fifteen minute journey which is fine in the daytime but the trains finish at 9 pm and is very expensive if you take Taxis back to the Hotel from the centre of Rome, the most unfortunate point I have to make is that at night time the place turns into a Red light area with the garden at the Hotel entrance being used by the ladies of the night and their clientele, it is with great regret that this Hotels reputation is soured by its location but it is only fair to point it out to fellow travellers

Reviews.Title: “staff are excellent”
Reviews.Author: earlifransiska
Reviews.Content: they are very helpfull, they give info without being asked, they keep you updated with your request, they give excellent help, good sleep coz far from noisy rome traffice, take the metro, and your problem solved, coz rome is small and everything is reachable with the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: PinedaP
Reviews.Content: Carpet is filthy. Booked through Booking.com a Triple with garden view: no garden view, only one double bed with a single sofa bed, staff wan not very apologetical, but provided me with a cot that was no different from sofa bed. Breakfast was ok, but fruit a bit passed. Fittings need some maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price”
Reviews.Author: vmalez
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Area in Rome has a very good quality price ratio. If you are ok with the basic needs (no restaurant, no gymn), but you are just looking for a clean and spacious room; then this hotel is for you. Compared with many other hotel in Rome, this one is very clean and the personell is incredibly friendly. Is not central, but is 10 minutes away from the metro (Marconi stop). If you look for an hotel in the same price range in Rome city centre, you'll probably find a low quality, not so clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfortable Room and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dot19
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through "top secret hotels" and so we were a apprehensive about what we might be getting. We read some of the reviews and got a bit scared about prostitutes and nuns etc. The hotel is next to a convent school and opposite a police station but we saw no prostitutes and the area seemed like a typical suburban zone - quiet, a couple of shops, a school and not much else. Marconi metro stop is just off the bottom of most Rome city maps but once you find the station no real trouble getting to the hotel, just keep walking left from the station. All of the reception staff were exceptionally friendly and the hotel felt clean, crisp and new. Our room was very nice, good sized bathroom and clean sheets and towels every day. The TV is only in italian but who wants tv when youre on holiday anyway? We bought breakfast in the hotel everyday as there were no nearby supermarkets and the cafe close to the metro station didnt look very inviting. The breakfast was continental with a slightly odd twist, cold eggs and chopped up sausages but the pastries were beautiful and a massive selection of fresh fruit. The restaurant that the reception staff reccommend, Conventos, is brilliant. It is the only restaurant close by, about 2mins walk down an unlit alley way, but its well worth the alley once you get there. We happily ate there every evening and the food and service never disappointed, it was full of italians which we felt was a good sign. The Bucatini all' amatrice is to die for! I would recommend Hotel Area whole heartedly to anybody travelling on a budget but looking for somewhere a bit decent to stay, the only compromise is on distance from the city centre, but who cares about a 5 minute train ride?

Reviews.Title: “Location not great but hotel looks good!”
Reviews.Author: SianM75
Reviews.Content: Slightly mis-leading description but reviews are correct - 5 mins from Marconi station and red light area! Hard to find at night so ensure you have good directions if arriving on foot. Can't complain about service or standard of hotel. If the hotel was more centrally located this would be a great hotel for tourists to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Value money if you need to stay to EUR business area”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: Compare to EUR Hotels rates it's a good deal; It was part of private school (still there) and if you go during shool time you'll be waked up from children going to school; different way to wake up isn't it? It's 5 walking minutes from subway stop (Marconi B line) bringing you to EUR business area or if you've time to downtown as well (other way around). Rooms are different so it depends about availability, but if you book regularly you can ask a larger room for same price. People at the reception is OK, if they are in a good shape, while house-keeping are kind. No inside resturant and morning breakfast it's boarder line between good and not enough; if you take italian one is quite OK; watch out if you're looking for american/continental breakfast, is not what you really expect.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff and priced right”
Reviews.Author: Cabnfever
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Rooms were nicely appointed with a good view to the garden. About a 10 min walk to the Marconi metro station, just have to watch out for the lady's of the night in the area as it is a business hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: KAST223
Reviews.Content: Traveling through Rome for 1 night on our way home and booked Area because of the price and decent reviews. Big mistake. Arrived by expensive taxi to this remote, issolated hotel behind a school off a highway to discover they "could no longer accomdate us". Entry glass door was shattered, front desk a mess, and carpet was filthy. We were actually relieved we wouldn't have to stay there! However it was a huge argument to get our money refunded because they had rebooked us in another hotel. We just wanted a refund so we could go back to Una Hotel where we had previously stayed which was halfway decent and IN Rome. They absolutely refused so we were forced to take another taxi to the hotel they rebooked us in. The worst hotel experience and service I've ever received. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Rome,”
Reviews.Author: joanazul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a real 4 stars hotel. Rooms very good and clean. Staff very friendly and always willing to help. Breakfast with plenty of things and always very fresh (specially fruit). The location is good for quality and price. Only 5 minutes from a metro stop. Less good: the location is good but a bit isolated and in the night you can feel a bit insecure, the shower is tiny, the room was too hot and we were not able to regulate it. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: charless7777
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend at area hotel in rome and our experience there was pretty good, the hotel is 4 min walking to the metro station, so that was great! Also the rooms are huge comparing with european rooms, the photos at the website are a little bit better than the reality, but still very nice hotel! The breakfast buffet was good also

Reviews.Title: “A generally satisfactory experience.”
Reviews.Author: mccunea
Reviews.Content: This is a modern boutique hotel situated a short walk from the Marconi metro station, a 15 minute journey from the main train station (Termini). Quiet residential area; a School, a Convent and a Police Station are the surrounding buildings. There are no shops etc in the vicinity. The room was clean and was serviced regularly; the room had a very small shower cubicle. Massive TV in room unfortunately the only channels available were Italian Freeview channels. Breakfast was satisfactory although it was charged as an extra. The hotel has a bar but no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kormensandiego
Reviews.Content: The hotel was generally ok, it was clean, front desk staff was friendly. The lobby looked excellent, very modern, the rooms were ok. We got a very big room because there were 3 of us. One had to sleep in the sofabed which was ok, compared to other sofabeds I've tried. The cushion was firm and had support, and did not fall off the springs. Airconditioning/Heating did not work too well, so we had to open the windows so that we get the air right. It was too warm most of the time, even if the heater was not on. It was actually great that the windows open as I normally don't like the dryness created by the heater. Breakfast was a great selection although the staff was very slow at serving. We went with a big group and we had a schedule to follow, but we fit just snuggly into their breakfast area so that should be used to serving groups. Half of our group would normally have to wait for additional food to be brought out. Free wi-fi was available at the lobby which was an excellent place to relax and catch up on emails. There was one blooper though, as the reception gave us a keycard that opened into a room with someone already in it. We later learned that she knew just after she handed us the keycard but asked other people in our group to go after us. In the first place, she should be the one informing us or the room occupants. Of course, it was too late. They did not even apologize to us nor the room occupants. Other than that, it was ok. Not a perfect hotel, but good for a 1-2 night stay for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: garybultitude
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid Jan 2011. The hotel is clean throughout. The hotel staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful, from booking taxis, booking restaurants etc, they made our stay! The continental breakfast has lots of variety with some very strange additions but tasty never the less. The hotel is a 7 minute walk from Marcconi station and there are some small shops nearby. One bad point was the hotel was a tad warm, but we opened the window in the room and it was fine. Oh if you stay go to a restaurant behind the hotel, go out of the hotel, chuck a right, walk down a hill and under a small bridge which brings you to a main road. GO right and there is a great restaurant. Proper home cooked meals and quite cheap. Dont get a cab you will get ripped off! Full of Italians, which is a good sign!. All in all a good hotel and would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too hot!!!”
Reviews.Author: pammy123
Reviews.Content: The only complaint regarding this hotel was that the room was really hot. We tried to turn down the radiators but the heat still kept pelting out. It was really cold whilst we were there but had to have the windows wide open most of the night. The room was not very big and neither was the shower. Overall the room regarding cleanliness etc was very good and the staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but don't be described as 4*”
Reviews.Author: FeniaFilippidou
Reviews.Content: Nice, cheap, clean, quiet, a bit difficult to find, next to train station but it's a good choice for an economic journey

Reviews.Title: “Unusual”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our Trafalgar tour of Italy. The hotel is reasonably modern and we had an enormous room. The air conditioning was not working but we could open the windows for fresh air, as it was a hot night. The bathroom was also very large, but had a tiny shower cubicle. I am petite but could hardly fit in the shower and my husband found it quite awkward. The hotel was clean and breakfast was fine and we had no complaints. It was okay for one night. We did not have dinner at the hotel as we went out for our farewell dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked!!”
Reviews.Author: sissi80_10
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Prime Hotel Area well in advance for a family trip to Rome and wanted to stay there for 4 nights. I had the confirmation from booking.com, but when we arrived in the hotel, the lady at the front desk told us that they had an electricity problem and we had to go to another hotel for the first night. We were appalled at the idea of having to change hotels after a day (you have to bear in mind that we had our one-year-old baby with us, her crib and all the ecquipment you need for a baby). After I talked to the manager, it turned out that they were overbooked and had no electricity problem at all. After us, 2 ladies managed to check-in and the justification of the front desk lady was that they were with a group. I would NEVER EVER book this hotel again since they are not reliable. We ended up cancelling the booking and travelling through Rome (with a crying baby because it had got so late after the looooong discussions with the hotel manager) to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The reception can't help you in any...”
Reviews.Author: Myrkky
Reviews.Content: The reception can't help you in any problems we had. We needed something to open our luggage, but the woman at the reception said only, wait for tomorrow. The breakfast was terrible at all. Of course all of us knew that the breakfast in italy is different to other european citys. But the things they had you couldn't eat at all. The rolls have been so hard, perhaps they were lying there since days. For the personal it was not possible to have enough things at the buffet. At the end there was only cheese at the breakfast. No bread or something else. Never had such a bad breakfast like that. And well, the thing is coming now: when we went back to the room, there was money stolen from our room. About 70 euro. We looked everywhere to find it. But nothing. We had the money in two bags, and no one could find it on the first view. We went back to the reception and asked there. She calls the cleaning woman to come to the reception. Of course, we never thought that they will say that they had stolen money. But one person said, that she has been in the room... Just to look if we had checked out already... Well for us everyting was clear. We will never book this hotel again. We can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the white and clean looking rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal1985
Reviews.Content: I was part of a large tour visiting Italy the past couple of weeks. Our first hotel we stayed at was at the Prime Hotel Area located at the Via del Forte Ostiense near Marconi station. I really thought reading the reviews here would prepare me and my family but i had no idea it would be worst than how it was described here. OK let's start with the positives. Goods: -Close to Marconi train station, a grocery store,restaurants, and mini fruit market -Decent hotel breakfast -Computer with internet available for 2 Euros for per half hour Ok now for the bad parts. On the first day of our arrival we were placed in a room that didn`t have a working shower. So we had to switch room. We were given a room that not only smelled like something had died in but it was dirty as well. That night there was about 300 ants crawling in the bathroom. I wish I had taken photos that night becuase it was something to see. From the bottom on the bathroom sink came an assembly line of working ants moving white pieces of some chunky stuff up to where the shower nosle was. Im not sqweemish about ants but it`s safe to say it made my skin crawl just thinking they might be in my room. Before going to bed I found a bed bug (red) and I immediately killed it and after inspecting the sheets I thought that was the end of that.The next morning I woke up with red spots on my legs and my right side. It was itchy and red. After complaining to the current owner -Giovanni- he said he would get housekeeping to take care of it. Instead the next night more ants showed up. My sheets were only changed one time after I complained even though I was told the hotel`s policy is that they are supposed to change it every morning. We stayed there for more than 4 nights. The hotel staff were completly inexperienced and only two showed professionalism. The rest need some serious training including the new management. It`s a very depressing hotel. The views facing to the back is almost like you`re in jail. It was a pretty dissapointing experience to say in the least. Sure the location is good but what good is it when you can`t sleep because you fear more bugs will bite you while you are sleeping which they did in my case. For the business people wifi is available but you have to pay. I honestly wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. THe hotel management didn't do anything for us to compensate for this horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: k_kavvadas
Reviews.Content: ....Hotel Lets put up things first. I booked the hotel by the prepaid not refundable offer but on the arrival day because of strikes on the airport our flight was canceled.Spoke with hotel and Areef and they change my arrival date and move my booking days without charce. Arrival on the hotel was Easy close to Marconi station 7 min walk. Annarita on the Reception and what a star she was!!!! Excellent smile worm wellcome on a minimal and beautiful lobby. She upgrade our booking on a much Bigger room 305. The room was Fantastic!!! Clean Neet Specious With a lot of natural light trow the big widows king size bed 32Lcd tv lounge area anda very clean bathroom(shower was great but a nice bath will top up everything). Breakfast was very good clean with a good sellection and Very Good Service from Both Ladies that always smile. Train to the city termini was 15 min and it was easy on saturday the metropolitana run until 1.30 which was great the rest days 11.30 was not so bad.But the bus is there from termini station and we use it on our last night cause we stay longer in the city No problem at all and also walking back to the hotel in the night did not worry me at all. I forgot to say a big Thank you to Annarita for solving the adaptor "problem" and gave back to my girlfriend her beautiful smile and Areef for all the info i needed about restaurants and etc. We would love to visit Rome again on day and if we do We Know where we gonna book and thats Prime Hotel Area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally rude!”
Reviews.Author: tiflosourtis
Reviews.Content: The personnel in Prime Hotel Area is totally rude,unwilling to help us in some simple issues. I wouldn't recommend it to no one!! They need to learn to respect the holidays of others... Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great value hotel in Rome with good service”
Reviews.Author: YY417
Reviews.Content: My best friend & i booked our tickets (london - rome) and hotel package through lastminute.com during 28-31 Dec (4 days, 3 nights) for 250GBP per person (including breakfast). Rate would be lower if we were not traveling during x'mas & new year holidays (we initially planned to go during early Dec and i did search cheaper package deal from lastminute.com during early Dec, but at the end we could only make it during end Dec, still i think 250 GBP was very good deal including air tickets and a good quality hotel with breakfast provided). I had chosen this hotel based on previous reviews during earlier this year, and then read the last 2 reviews with negative feedbacks after i'd booked everything....had to say that i did start to get a bit worried after reading those 2 reviews.... But after spending 4 days / 3 nights in Prime Hotel Area, I think i could offer a more reasonable review on this hotel and answer some of the doubts for others who had also read those 2 negative comments: 1. hotel location: Honestly, it ISN'T that far from city, just 7 metro stations between Termini and Marconi (where the hotel is), and frequency of metro is considered high (less than 5 mins for every train), and from marconi to termini will take less than 15mins metro drive. The bus station isnt too far from the hotel but it takes longer if you prefer to walk less (to metro station) and wait for a bus to go into city areas. BUT< have to say that the hotel can do a better job by offering a easier understanding location map for customers instead of using the google map version cos its quite misleading if you follow the map and use "Via Ostiense" cos it would lead to you the highway!!!! (which was exactly what happened to us and i was so scared that i would be run over by those cars on the highway!!!!) While we could actually follow directly the road outside metro station, which means after you leave metro station to the ground entrance, turn left and keep walking for 5-8mins until you see a very very old gas station in opposite road, then you cross at the traffic light and after you arrive at the old gas station, you'll see hotel sign when you turn right after the gas station and see the hotel within 500cm... Just one direct road to walk back and forth to and from the metro station <-> hotel. Straight forward and no difficulty at all! Night time walking back to the hotel however was abit too quiet but the area seems ok, we (2 girls) went back to hotel every night at least after 9pm and we are totally fine :) still i receommend at least 2 of you walking together rather than alone... 2. Breakfast options: Fairly speaking, for a budget rate hotel in big city like Rome, this one has done their job with breakfast selection, they offer assorted bread / crossiants, yoghurt in original flavor / mixed berries / strawberry / peach / banana; fresh fruits like green apples, oranges, mandarins, kiwi fruits; cappucino / latte / hot chocolate from machine (which i think they taste reasonably nice comparing to those i paid 2 - 3euros per cup from cafe shops inside rome city....) i am not too into fruit juice so the juice option doesnt bother me at all but probably maybe a pain for ppl who loves having a glass of real fruit juice for breakfast (if yes, no offend but i do think you gotta raise your budget and book another more expensive hotel......); they also have ham and hot scramble egg. So let's be fair, you dont always get what you pay in every hotel but i think this hotel has done a pretty good job by offering as much variety as possible within a budget. 3. Very limited restaurant options nearby the hotel and without one inside the hotel: Correct, its true, but since it takes me less than 20mins to go back to the hotel from Termini, i dont mind staying in Termini or area near colosseo for dinner / lunch in any of the Trattorias, and also i spent most of the day (and night) outside the hotel and in the tourist areas, whats the point going back to the hotel to have dinner / lunch / or even a drink (well, if i'm spending a sun & beach holidays in resort areas like Bali or Guam, yes, i would definitely need a hotel with nice restaurants options and bars selection). So this part of the comments doesnt bother me at all. So unless you're planning to spend most of your time in Rome to have meals in hotel, otherwise this hotel is definitely not a bad pick :) 4. Hotel staff service: we're very lucky to have Anna to serve us when we checked in and out from the hotel, she's absolutely amazing! She's friendly, speaks fluent english in very polite manner and helpful attitude, gives good advise on bus station direction, and suggestion on getting to the airport by train (never once she recommended us to take limo with any limo company, not once!). She's been very very nice to us and gave us many useful advice for travelling inside the city. But we did meet a very rude male staff from the front desk (an older guy looks like in his 50's...... 5'11 tall roughly), he's complete bad news to the whole hotel's service standard, we also noticed that he's especially rude and nasty to women customers, if you ever have the chance to see him in the hotel, good luck to you and I will definitely hope not to see him again in this hotel!!!! But we were lucky that most of the time we needed help from front desk, Anna was there to help us! Thanks so much for her help again! 5. other ares: room's very tidy and spacious, our friend spent much more to book a hotel in Termini area but the inside of their room cannot compare to ours. Amenities were replenished everyday, hotel's heating is very warm, you wont feel cold at all inside your room and they're not stingy with heating as well!!! Breakfast hall is clean and tidy, food was refilled constantly. The hotel is not noisy at all even it's near the highway :) so if you're looking for a comfortable place to stay in rome within a budget, this is a very good choice. I hope this reviews will help to provide a more objective point of view since the last 2 negative reviews, we all just have to adjust our expectations fairly when you're staying in a budget hotel without be too critisizing. Dont expect to be treated in Four Seasons when you're paying for ibis ;)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - almost shocked”
Reviews.Author: redbreast
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with Hotel Area. No bar, no restaurant, nothing to eat or drink in the in the vicinity, and a front desk that almost cost me my flight... Upon arrival my taxi driver (local) couldn't find the place it is in such an odd location. Some five miles south of the city, with a major highway and gas station on one side and a narrow lane the other, the immediate approach gives the impression of a down at heel block of flats. Upon entry things look up with a modern lounge area but it is a vacuous place in the evening. The only restaurant in walking distance is the shockingly bad Lo Convento - never take the short cut but even the main road is dangerous - uneven footpaths, unlit, speeding cars. with a mid evening arrival I ended up eating crisps in my room so little is there in the surrounding area. Breakfast is as poor as you could find even in Italy: tinned fruit, over-sweetened squash not juice, poor coffee and stale rolls while congealed scrambled eggs and chopped frankfurters constitute the hot option - why bother I wonder? But I could forgive all that other than the front desk's unilateral decision not to order me a local cab as i requested upon departure. Instead without asking or telling me they called "their" limo company because I was going to the airport. For this a car has to arrive from central Rome - at rush hour! The result was a 50 minute wait for a car to arrive and a huge amount of stress. My assumption: putting a kick back ahead of guests' immediate needs. Unacceptable anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “i will not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: litsaAthens
Reviews.Content: we have reserved a triple deluxe room and they gave us a double one. we have to wait to find a triple one. the breakfast was poor and same everyday.there is no restaurant at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, nice location”
Reviews.Author: tyge68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, very clean and nice room, large flat screen tv, large bed and bathroom is large too, only improvement would be to have another furniture in the bathroom to put the accessories on it. wireless network only available in the lobby, but a computer is available for free access too. The location is nice, on the 170 bus line (stop is the last in Marconi , just after the Marconi Metro, which is about 300 m from the hotel), so both options bus or metro are possible, bus is good to do sightseeing while going to the center of Roma (piazza venizia).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: vacaay2009
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not near the Termini, but is VERY close to the metro, and 6 stops away from Central Rome. The hotel looked very ghetto from the outside, but from the inside was VERY VERY NICE! The rooms were very neat and clean. The bathroom, especially, shower was a little bit small. The breakfast was a good spread, and they provided free interent for their guests. (They have a computer in the lobby for guests to use) The staff was very helpful in printing something for us when we needed to at no extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ikes69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, was extremely happy with the look and feel for the Hotel and it is really worth the amount paid. Not advisible for people wanting to stay in central Rome , and the lady which works the day shift at reception really needs to learn some manners. The rooms are not sound proof at all ...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Area Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Forte Ostiense s/n | Viale Marconi, 700, 00146 Rome, Italy
